		Question: what did dr josef mengele do
		Answer:
answer: Josef Mengele was a member of the Schutzstaffel (SS) during World War II. He was a physician who conducted experiments on inmates at the Auschwitz concentration camp. These experiments included injecting chemicals into inmates' eyes and exposing them to gas chambers.
